rev.comment: moved section so we first have technical issues and then "social" issues (more or less)
rev.diff:
Line 203: Line 203:
===Technical complexity===
===Technical complexity===
Transactions are based on scripts that are contained inside the transactions and are to be executed to 'access the money'. While this increases flexibility of transactions, it does complicate the development of Bitcoin applications.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://forum.bitcoin.org/index.php?topic=4278.msg104751#msg104751 | title=What would you change about the Bitcoin protocol?|author=alkor}}</ref>
Transactions are based on scripts that are contained inside the transactions and are to be executed to 'access the money'. While this increases flexibility of transactions, it does complicate the development of Bitcoin applications.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://forum.bitcoin.org/index.php?topic=4278.msg104751#msg104751 | title=What would you change about the Bitcoin protocol?|author=alkor}}</ref>
  +   +
===Difficulty in defending the network===
  +
[[Ben Laurie]] has stated that secure decentralized currencies are nearly impossible to create as it would require over 50% of the world's computing power. <ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.links.org/files/decentralised-currencies.pdf | title=Decentralised Currencies Are Probably Impossible. But Let's At Least Make Them Efficient. | accessdate=July 03, 2011}}</ref>
===Fluctuation===
===Fluctuation===
Line 223: Line 226:
===Covert "mining"===
===Covert "mining"===
In June, 2011, [[Symantec]] warned about the possibility of [[botnet]]s engaging in covert "mining" of bitcoins (unauthorized use of resources of computers to generate bitcoins).<ref>http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/bitcoin-botnet-mining</ref>. Later that month, an employee of [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] was caught after using the company's servers to generate bitcoins.<ref>http://thenextweb.com/au/2011/06/23/abc-employee-caught-mining-for-bitcoins-on-company-servers/</ref>
In June, 2011, [[Symantec]] warned about the possibility of [[botnet]]s engaging in covert "mining" of bitcoins (unauthorized use of resources of computers to generate bitcoins).<ref>http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/bitcoin-botnet-mining</ref>. Later that month, an employee of [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] was caught after using the company's servers to generate bitcoins.<ref>http://thenextweb.com/au/2011/06/23/abc-employee-caught-mining-for-bitcoins-on-company-servers/</ref>
